Present location: INSTITUT DE PAPYROLOGIE ET D'ÉGYPTOLOGIE, UNIVERSITÉ DE LILLE III [02/049] LILLE
Name: Jar stand
Description: Jar stand, wheel-made from a buff-coloured clay, with extremely pronounced convex edges (lips). The upper lip is 1 cm thick and the lower one, 0,5 cm. There are two funnel-shaped orifices, the upper from 5 to 3,5 cm wide, the lower 7,8 to 4 cm. The red colouring of the entire object bears traces of a decoration in white paint on most of it. A number of chips exist.
